revised_title: Discovery of Oxyiodine and Its Chemical Properties
tldr: The author, Humphry Davy, conducted experiments on a solid compound of iodine and oxygen and discovered a new compound called oxyiodine. Oxyiodine has various chemical properties, such as decomposing into iodine and oxygen under heat and reacting with water to form oxyiodic acid. It also acts on metals, forming insoluble precipitates and combining with acids to create new compounds.
